answers.answer: I was never measured with my previous pregnancies. My last one was 10 years ago. Now that I'm 37, i get to have an ultrasound to measure the baby. I've never had or heard of shoulder screening.!?

Shoulder screening is an assessment Web based questionaire they ask a bunch of question such as, is this your 1st pregnancy, pre-weight & height which they have on file, glucose test passed or failed, gestational diabetes,age which I'm 31 so based on these silly questions this web-based program could estimate if the baby will have wide shoulders and if that's the case they assume that at delivery once the baby's head I'd out he or she might have trouble or their shoulders might be stuck and could cause shoulder dystocia. In other words it's an assessment to make sure that I know that c section might be an option. Personally I think it's stupid it's very new and vague.
I never heard of that either^^ sounds like another way to get you for a unnecessary csection... But u can ask for another ultrasound if insurance will cover it...

I just got measured at my 35 week appt so dont worry if not just ask . Also doctors don't all work the same way as long as they are giving you proper care and treatment don't stress and trust them .  They went to school for this.

I ask my doc if the baby would be measured for an estimated weight and she said they like to wait until we're closer to our due date.  After 37 weeks, preferably around 38-39 if all is still going well.

question: Is it normal they have yet to tell me or est my baby's weight....nothing, no ultrasound all I'm scheduled for on Monday is strep B rest and a shoulder screening which is stupid bc it's based on a questionaire to estimate if my baby had wide shoulders.. wth???
title: I'm 35 weeks I'll be 36 tomorrow
